messages: 4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (19:49): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 re "abandoned" in http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-webapps/2011JulSep/0454.html
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (19:49): ‚Ä¶ can you elaborate a bit on what you mean?
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (19:49): The only people who matter, browser vendors? :)
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (19:50): ms2ger, did any browser implement that spec?
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (19:51): At least somewhat
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (19:51): and no apps/documents use them?
bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350 (19:51): I don't know why "somewhat"
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (19:52): 4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27, the members of these interfaces are defined in HTML now
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (19:55): so, I'm asking myself, if these attributes are added to HTML5, are they the "ideas" really "abandoned"
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (19:58): The indirection provided by these interfaces? yes
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (19:59): 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81, in your own words, what are the essential points you want to make?
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (19:59): "This spec sucks"
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (19:59): Something like that? :)
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (20:00): the spec is ~1/2 of 1 page
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:08): 4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27, the concept that a document can have multiple views never got traction
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:09): 4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27, that Document and the global object have a connection is true, but that is not because of views
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:09): 4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27, and only takes about one paragraph
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (20:11): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0, I think the text should be a bit clearer. We can talk about it here or on public-webapps. Do you have a pref?
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (20:11): Please don't dump that into my inbox
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (20:12): well adding "This spec sucks" isn't gonna' fly ;-)
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (20:12): Adrian said " A note in the status
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (20:12): section indicating that on-going work to supersede this document is being
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (20:12): done in the HTML5 specification would be appropriate.

e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:14): 4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27, we could just say "The concepts this document defines are obsolete. The IDL attributes it defines are being defined in HTML5 with simplified semantics."
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:15): and then "The WebApps WG encourages implementation of these concepts as defined by HTML5."
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (20:15): Anne, I like that more
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (20:16): how about s/IDL attributes/'document' and 'defaultView' attributes/
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:16): sure
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (20:17): I think the two sentences used in the CSS notes are reasonable additions. WDYT Anne?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:17): "This paragraph is informative. This document is currently not maintained." ?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:17): sure
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:18): maybe strike currently
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (20:19): so I think this means:

4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (20:19): Note: This paragraph is informative. This document is currently not maintained. The concepts this document defines are obsolete. The 'document' and 'defaultView' attributes are being defined in HTML5 with simplified semantics. The Web Applications WG encourages implementation of these concepts as defined by HTML5.
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:19): sounds good
